sentences.en: He found himself at a loss for words of consolation.
sentences.cn: 他简直想不出安慰的话来.

sentences.en: He had the consolation of knowing that he couldn’t have done any better.
sentences.cn: 他知道自己已经尽了最大努力，心中便有了安慰。

sentences.en: He knew then he was right, but it was no consolation.
sentences.cn: 当时他知道自己是正确的，但这并不能给他任何安慰。

sentences.en: He wanted to comfort her, to offer her some kind of consolation.
sentences.cn: 他想安慰她, 给她一点东西.

sentences.en: He would repeat the word " Yeomen " as if it afforded him consolation.
sentences.cn: 他要把 自耕农 三个字重复一下,好象给他安慰似的.

sentences.en: Her appointment was seen as a consolation prize after she lost the election.
sentences.cn: 大家认为对她的任命只不过是落选之后的安慰罢了。

sentences.en: His letters of advice and consolation entertained me vastly.
sentences.cn: 他的劝告和安慰的信使我非常开心.

sentences.en: If it’s any consolation, things do get easier as the child gets older.
sentences.cn: 聊可安慰的是，随着这孩子慢慢长大，境况也好起来了。

sentences.en: Judith had scarcely attended to this rude attempt of Hurry's consolation.
sentences.cn: 朱迪思对赫里的这些粗鲁的安慰话根本不在意.

sentences.en: The children were a great consolation to me at that time.
sentences.cn: 那时孩子们成了我的莫大安慰.

sentences.en: The little girl is a great consolation to her parents.
sentences.cn: 这小女孩是他父母的莫大安慰.

sentences.en: The next match will probably offer them the consolation of winning.
sentences.cn: 下一场比赛可能给他们带来获胜的安慰.

sentences.en: There is some consolation for fans because the team still stands a chance of winning the local championship.
sentences.cn: 使球迷感到有些安慰的是这个队仍然有机会赢得当地比赛冠军.

sentences.en: They turn to the religious quarter for consolation.
sentences.cn: 他们转向宗教那里去寻安慰.

sentences.en: When her mother died, she found consolation in her religious beliefs.
sentences.cn: 当她母亲去世时, 她在宗教信仰中找到了安慰.

sentences.en: Your solicitude was a great consolation to me.
sentences.cn: 你对我的关怀给了我莫大的安慰.

words.tran_cn: [计] 控制台；[电] 操纵台
安慰；慰问；起安慰作用的人或事物

trans.tran_en: something that makes you feel better when you are sad or disappointed
